CA Residential LoadNonPrivilegedpst FYI Starting on the th traded today all of the residential load requirements for California will begin rolling off with the last day of rolloffs on July At this point EES will no longer have a residential load commitment This will amount to an average of to MW per hour that will be rolled off Please let me know if you have any questions Thanks Michael D Spruiell Analyst Commodity Risk Management Load Forecasting Desk Office Pager

Forecast Report using Forecasted vs Actual Weather Data Cc NonPrivilegedpst This report compares load forecasts created using forecasted weather data in order to create dayahead schedules and forecasts created using actual weather data received after the forecast date has passed It will be provided regularly in order to keep you informed of the accuracy of our forecasts based on unexpected changes in weather If you have any questions or concerns please feel free to contact me Thank you Michael D Spruiell Analyst Commodity Risk Management Load Forecasting Desk Office Pager

JUNE SCHEDULE Cc NonPrivilegedpst Phil This document gives the estimated load for JUNE and as well as our current positions We will call tomorrow to discuss the positions before we send out the actual schedule for June and Thanks Michael Spruiell
